definition: to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
surname Shao/name of an ancient state that existed in what is now Shaanxi Province
to call together/to summon/to convene/temple or monastery (used in place names in Inner Mongolia)

sentences.english: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌基督的僕人保羅，奉召爲使徒，特派傳神的福音。

sentences.english: Paul, a servant of Christ Jesus, called to be an apostle, set apart for the gospel of God.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌基督的僕人保羅，奉召爲使徒，特派傳神的福音。

sentences.english: The military were called out to put down the riot.
sentences.chinese: 軍隊奉召出動去鎮壓暴動。

sentences.english: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God
sentences.chinese: 耶穌基督的僕人保羅，奉召爲使徒，特派傳神的福音。

sentences.english: Thou hast thy calling to some palace floor.
sentences.chinese: 你奉召進殿堂使命可鑑。

definition: ordained or appointed to a post/to benefit from counsel
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
surname Shao/name of an ancient state that existed in what is now Shaanxi Province
to call together/to summon/to convene/temple or monastery (used in place names in Inner Mongolia)
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
